net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.comm
Class BaseMonitor

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.comm.BaseMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, ECUMonitor
Direct Known Subclasses:
LoggerPlaybackMonitor, RS232Monitor, TestMonitor
public abstract class BaseMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ECUMonitor

All monitors should really extend this class. Although the ECUMonitor is the primary interface, this method provides a few necessary initialization and setup functions. And the markTime() method.

Field Detail

params_

protected java.util.List<ECUParameter> params_
This list will hold the entire list of ECU Bound parameters

doRun_

protected java.lang.Boolean doRun_
You'll need this. This flag indicates that the thread is to be run or not. As long as this flag is true, then keep looping in your run() method. As soon as it's set to false, you can drop out of the loop, and exit the run() method

Constructor Detail

BaseMonitor

public BaseMonitor()
Create a new base monitor instance. This is the core monitor for almost all monitors.

Method Detail

init

public java.util.List<Parameter> init(ParameterRegistry reg,
                                      InitListener initListener)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
If you extend this class, you MUST call this super.init() method. Otherwise this base monitor will not init correctly. The return value is always null from this method, so you'll need to create your own parameter list, and return it, if you wish. Override

Specified by:
init in interface ECUMonitor
Returns:
a list of parameters that this monitor claims to support. This is a list for reference only, it is NOT used to initialize anything.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a fatal init problem.
See Also:

resetDTCs

public void resetDTCs()
               throws java.lang.Exception
The default is that the DTC Reset is NOT supported. If your monitor class uspportes it, then you MUST override this method. Override

Specified by:
